title: Riot, Will Kog'Maw ever be addressed?
body:
It's only been one patch, but Riot has had plenty of time to look at Kog and where he stands as of late.

Do I want him reverted? No, I actually like his new identity as a moving turret and it really puts him apart from other marksman.

Does he need attention? Yes, mainly because he doesn't really spike into late game as well as other late carries like Jinx or Vayne. 

And given his sub-par late game, his early game is some of the weakest out of all marksman. His only real power spike is when he gets Rageblade and Runaan's; allowing him to deal actual damage with his auto attacks and W. 

Now, I'm no expert league player. I'm also still experimenting with his build paths, but so far he's only reliable if he has enough sustain to heal up while enemies wail on him. 

Not only that, but Rageblade and Runaan's have become staples, only giving him 3-slot options to itemize into either pure damage in hopes to get a kill, or sustain to stay alive while he wittles them down (boots take up a space, and we all know it's berserker's).

This doesn't seem healthy at all, because a full-AD or AP Kog isn't going to aid his team as well as a sustain-built Kog due to how low his scaling is. 55% AD while W is active is fine because he ends up dealing % HP damage, but it's scaling is only in AP and it's pretty low at that. 

I really like where he was taken, but right now, he isn't looking so hot in both diversity and numbers. I would rather have a low-scaling hybrid ratio Kog Maw or a better scaling, single ratio (AD or AP) Kog Maw than a low scaling semi-hybrid-AP-leniant "needs to build sustain and attack speed" Kog Mawnstrosity.

This is one of the problems with the Juggermaw comps.  It's really, *really* easy to shut down if you're expecting it.  A targeted ban on any of the champions needed to prop him up makes the whole thing fall appart.

's why I suspect trying to balance Koggy around LCS level, specifically-tailored team compositions will be dead in the water.  Why would you want to balance a champion around a use case that impacts vastly less than a tenth of one percent of the player base?

The worst part is that Koggy can't really maintain that sustained damage fantasy because the uptime on his W is so lacking.  If you want a burst of crazy damage from a Marksmen, wouldn't you be better off picking MF or Twitch?

As of now, his only viability are Rageblade and someone to peel for him.

He has no means of kiting, so once an enemy hops on you, you're going to die if they already aren't at 1/2 health. 

He's also no longer viable in a solo lane because of his numbers and poor scaling. Not only is he super squishy, but he has no way to disengage or at least poke enemies at a safe distance. His R is now an execute, which was once the main reason Kog mid was a thing.

If he goes solo now, he's naturally forced under tower and has to farm with a risk of being dived on and losing farm to the turret.

I'm not a pro, but I'm speaking from experience.

I'll give you a +1 on feast or famine, but I have to disagree on your reasoning against Rageblade Kog, and here's why:

It takes about 6 seconds to proc Rageblade when Kog isn't using his W, and about 4 seconds when he is during early-mid game. 

During this time, any form of harass and CC is going to stop him. You're getting a   6 second window to engage, kill, and walk out. 

If the enemy (you) can freeze a lane at river or near my tower, you're causing my Rageblade to reset after each wave, causing me to either push out and keep it going or proc Rageblade again during the next wave.

My biggest fear in playing Kog Maw is harass and early engages. I have no escape and I'm not as strong as you are until my gunblade. If you put that to your advantage, I'm not going to do anything for my team until 30 minutes into the game when I can barely keep up as much as the other marksman, who's probably someone much stronger than I am late game.


As for coordination, I can say the same to the enemy. It takes less coordination to get the assassin or fighter like Lee Sin or Jax to kill me first than it does to get my allies to CC and peel my already dead body. I don't survive and can't do anything when someone's on top of me in a fight, and I can't get my Rageblade to proc until the fight is already rolling or over with

AP Kog needs better poke to be viable mid. I think someone suggested that it scale with missing health but without these sudden break points where his damage spikes. That way, his damage can increase more normally and predictably. I don't know where the link was but I think that was the basic idea and he suggested some changes to AP scaling too.

I know some people didn't like playing against AP Kog but if assassins are strong, if engage is good, if split-pushing is viable and if there are enough early objectives to push leads, he isn't a problem. I don't think he has been a problem for a very long time in either competitive or soloq ue even though S5 was more favorable to him than most. Also, I don't think if he were a problem his entire play pattern should be killed instead of simply adjusting numbers. It's not like if Twitch was strong they'd suddenly remove his stealth ability so why would Kog's poke mage role be removed?

I know he can ADC too but other ADCs like Corki, Twitch, MF, Lucian, Graves, Ashe, Jinx etc. are all much more fun and not stuck in one build or comp. I can even go Ghostblade Ashe and get good burst or I can go 40% CDR utility with Ionian, ER, Runaan's, or a more traditional build with IE-RFC-Berserker's and even there I can decide on LW+ or Black Cleaver instead. Kog can't even go for a crit. build anymore. I pick Kog and there are no surprises in his bot build or play style (even fewer outplays with the way W works now). AP Kog is much cooler but sadly in an even worse state.

At least I have mid Corki now. :) He's really fun and has a great early-mid game with nice roams. His biggest problem is late game when they group and I think it's just because he lacks CC. Anyway, he's a much better pick than before and probably stronger than AP Kog used to be but I've only played him in normals and of course he's a totally different champion from Kog.

Personally, only AP Kog was interesting and fun to me. I don't think that's viable vs better players anymore. Also, if I have to build him Rageblade Nashor's for mid too, that makes his playstyle just like ADC Kog but for a different lane. The uniqueness of AP Kog was what attracted me to him before and I don't want to play the same ADC style in a different lane.

I just want mid AP Kog to be a reasonable choice again. It feels like he's a second class citizen. With his poke being nerfed a lot, it's hard to justify picking him considering his vulnerability and lack of strong CC. [This](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/RcMpy4qi-why-kog-mid-isnt-a-thing-anymore) explains it well. 

Beyond being weak though, I think he lacks build flexibility now and is[ fundamentally less interesting to play at the moment.](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/ll6gkAek-heres-a-post-where-you-can-ask-questions-about-the-stuff-ive-worked-on-and-ill-try-to-answer?comment=003900000000) I'll grant that some of this may be due to items. For example, Runaan's is a funny item for him because it sounds so natural but at the same time the crit. is much less useful for his normal builds and the AS is missed from the old Runaan's. It actually synergizes much better with someone like Twitch than it does with Kog and his on-hits.

She is a great harass, because with her w, she can move faster than Kog. Honestly, Kog doesn't need to be drastically changed or frankly, even touched, but some people are looking too hard at kog'maw, when he has almost no issues.
